required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on Central Transport Characteristics of Flurbiprofen Axetil in Elderly Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Study on Central Transport Characteristics of Flurbiprofen Axetil in Elderly Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The project will apply the methods of clinical observation experiment to study the central transport characteristics of flurbiprofen axetil by detecting S-flurbiprofen and R-flurbiprofen concentrations in cerebral-spinal fluid(CSF) after intravenous injection of flurbiprofen axetil in elderly patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The patients undergoing spinal anesthesia for lower extremity surgery will be studied. Flurbiprofen axetil 100mg will be injected intravenously. CSF 1ml and blood 2ml will be obtained simultaneously every 5 minutes after intravenous injection in 50 min( T1~T10).CSF and blood samples will be used to detected S-flurbiprofen and R-flurbiprofen concentrations by using Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry. And the CSF/blood S-flurbiprofen and R-flurbiprofen concentrations ratio were calculated.

primary_outcome.measure: The concentrations of S-flurbiprofen and R-flurbiprofen in plasma and CSF of all patients.
primary_outcome.description: The samples will be used to be determined plasma and CSF drug concentrations.

arm_group.description: At 5 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 10 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 15 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 20 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 25 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 30 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 14 patients' samples were required to be collected,including 7 younger patients
At 35 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 40 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 45 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected
At 50 minutes after flurbiprofen axetil injected intravenously, 7 aged patients' samples were required to be collected

study_pop.textblock: ASA I or lII, both sexes, aged 18-85 yr

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing lower extremity surgery under spinal or combined spinal-epidural anesthesia will be selected.
Exclusion Criteria:
- asthma, liver insufficiency, renal insufficiency, peptic ulcer, allergy to NSAIDs, and a history use of NSAIDs within two weeks before operation.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of department of anesthesiology and painmanagement
